content: AI companies are spending obscene money to build out their tech, and companies like MSFT are stuffing LLMs into every product, which costs them in terms of compute spend. None of this scales. None of it makes business sense.

Lmfao we had this on at the bar a couple weeks back and one of the people in the championship had a big ass leather jacket all decked out in Excel / MSFT logos. I couldn't get the sound on in the bar quick enough to hear the commentators, but that shit is wild..
In this case tho OpenAI just gets folded into msft so the buttons won‚Äôt change

This will force deployments to be more ‚Äúintentional‚Äù because the companies running the models won‚Äôt want to be jammed into a bunch of loss leader shit nobody wants

Except for the ones these posts are complaining lol, meta runs their own already and MSFT will own openai

I see some people be like "well I'm bullish on Anthropic but totally bearish on OpenAI" but like, ChatGPT represents 80% of the market for ordinary-consumer-facing usage, and I think ppl should consider the knock-on effects of that company visibly collapsing, even if MSFT just absorbs them.

"Do you think MSFT is ruthless enough..." is the start to a question that answers itself.
Do you think msft is ruthless enough to call in the chit or will it all be renegotiated?

MSFT has other lines of business into which this technology can be used well, while open AI is trying to build a software instantiated god and will only succeed financially if they do or get very close.

If you think that MSFT will own OpenAI IP in the end, does that mean your bearishness on OpenAI is solely because how the business is run and not the IP/product itself? If so, what would change under MSFT?

MSFT also has the most links to large corporate enterprises and IMO that‚Äôs where a lot of the value of AI will be (generating notes of meeting, auto designing corporate slide decks, writing first drafts of SOWs and proposals, writing proper emails)
I mean, that's kind of the bullish case for OpenAI, isn't it; in the worst case they just get folded into MSFT anyways
the reason i am bullish on msft is that they will end up owning all of OpenAI's IP for free.
